page.title: 19A children's guide
page.content: Lavenham is an interesting old town in Suffolk which has a variety of facilities for children,including a youth club and Scouts,Guides,Brownies and Cubs.As well as tennis courts the playing field has a well equipped children's playground.There is another good playground at the end of Water Street.Lavenham has a wide selection of shops catering for children but there are no fast food outlets,although when you are hungry there are pubs, restaurants and tea-rooms.On Tuesday and Friday a fish and chip van calls. Lavenham has many interesting medieval buildings,including our beautiful Church of St Peter and St Paul,the Priory and the Swan Hotel.The Guild- hall also has a library and an infor- mation museum where details of the life of the authoress of Â£Twinkle,twinkle little star' can be found.
